title: Vedic Way to Create Perfect Society | HDG Srila Prabhupada | Bg 1.44 | 27.07.2024
speaker: HDG Srila Prabhupada

segments.key_quote: Alas, how strange it is that we are preparing to commit greatly sinful acts, driven by the desire to enjoy royal happiness.
segments.summary: Arjuna is conscious of moral principles and avoids sinful acts driven by selfish motives.

segments.key_quote: It was arranged by Kṛṣṇa for his satisfaction, not for Arjuna's satisfaction.
segments.summary: The speaker clarifies that the events in Bhagavad-gita were arranged by Krishna for His satisfaction, not Arjuna's.

segments.key_quote: That is His satisfaction, not Arjuna's satisfaction, not anyone's satisfaction. It is His plan.
segments.summary: The speaker distinguishes devotional service from ordinary work, emphasizing Krishna's mission to protect the good and vanquish the wicked.

segments.key_quote: So kinsman does not mean, in higher sense, only my brother or my sister or my father or my uncle. Sa janam means all living entities because one who hasn't got Kṛṣṇa consciousness, ordinary consciousness, material consciousness, he cannot think in terms of sa janam, my kinsmen, all living entities. He cannot think.
segments.summary: The speaker explains that the real purpose of religious life is to establish Krishna consciousness, and kinsmen means all living entities.

segments.key_quote: Therefore, a devotee of Kṛṣṇa does not want to commit a little harm to any living entity.
segments.summary: The speaker asserts that Krishna is the Supreme Father of all living entities, and a devotee of Krishna does not want to harm any living entity.

segments.key_quote: Krishna also reciprocates. He has no discrimination that here is gopi, beautiful girl, therefore I shall love her more. Than the calf. No. Krishna is not so partial.
segments.summary: The speaker explains that Krishna loves everyone equally and a Krishna conscious devotee also sees everyone equally.

segments.key_quote: The living part, the soul is the same dimension either within the ant or in the elephant.
segments.summary: The speaker describes the dimension of the soul and explains that a pundit sees the soul in everyone, regardless of their external form.

segments.key_quote: If we want to kill any living entity, for my satisfaction, either my tongue satisfaction or any sense satisfaction, it is mahāpāpaṁ great sinful act.
segments.summary: The speaker explains that killing any living entity for one's own satisfaction is a great sin.

segments.key_quote: Unfortunately, everyone is killing for his sense satisfaction, gratification, in the name of religion.
segments.summary: The speaker laments that people kill for sense gratification, even in the name of religion, and questions how they can be happy.

segments.key_quote: If you want to feel happiness by your, this blunt material senses, that is not happiness. Happiness is beyond your material senses.
segments.summary: The speaker defines real happiness as being beyond material senses and achieved through purified senses employed for Krishna's sake.

segments.key_quote: But if we do the same thing for Kṛṣṇa's satisfaction, that is spiritual advancement.
segments.summary: The speaker contrasts acting for one's own sense gratification with acting for Krishna's satisfaction, stating that the latter leads to spiritual advancement.

segments.key_quote: Whatever you do for your own satisfaction, for the satisfaction of your whims, that is mahāpā, great sin. The same thing, when you do for Kṛṣṇa, that is opening your path to liberation, back to home, back to God.
segments.summary: The speaker emphasizes the difference between working for one's own satisfaction and working for Krishna's satisfaction, stating that the latter leads to liberation.

segments.key_quote: It doesn't matter whether you are a śūdra or you are brāhmaṇa, but if you act for the satisfaction of Kṛṣṇa according to the prescription of your position, then your life is perfect. That is wanted.
segments.summary: The speaker explains that perfection of life is achieved by acting for the satisfaction of Krishna according to one's prescribed duties within the varnasrama system.

segments.key_quote: Although superficially it appears that Kṛṣṇa is engaging Arjuna to fight in the sinful activities. No. That is not sinful. Whatever Kṛṣṇa does, it is not sinful. It is transcendental. The most pure activity.
segments.summary: The speaker explains that human civilization should be based on the principle of satisfying Krishna, and that Kṛṣṇa's actions are transcendental and not sinful.

segments.key_quote: Similarly, even though somebody comes to Kṛṣṇa with some purpose which is not moral, but the man or woman who comes there, he becomes, he or she becomes purified. And Kṛṣṇa does not become immoral.
segments.summary: The speaker defends Kṛṣṇa's actions against accusations of immorality, using the analogy of the sun purifying even impure things.

segments.key_quote: These rascals, they do not know what is Kṛṣṇa. They think Kṛṣṇa is ordinary man.
segments.summary: The speaker criticizes those who misunderstand Kṛṣṇa and His activities, particularly the rāsa dance, and emphasizes that it should not be discussed among fools.

segments.key_quote: Kāma means lust. What is lust? Lust means whenever you try to satisfy your senses, that is called lust. And the same, whenever you try to satisfy Kṛṣṇa's senses, that is love.
segments.summary: The speaker clarifies that Kṛṣṇa is not immoral and is not engaging Arjuna in sinful activities, and that the difference between lust and love is whether one is satisfying their own senses or Kṛṣṇa's.

segments.key_quote: Therefore we require the guidance of the spiritual master. Kṛṣṇa, guru-kṛṣṇa-kṛpāya.
segments.summary: The speaker emphasizes the importance of acting for Kṛṣṇa under proper direction and the necessity of guidance from a spiritual master.

segments.key_quote: Don't hear Bhagavad-gītā or any talk about Kṛṣṇa from a person who is not a Vaiṣṇava, who is not a devotee of Kṛṣṇa. We will misunderstand.
segments.summary: The speaker warns against hearing about Kṛṣṇa from non-devotees, as it can lead to misunderstanding, and reiterates that Kṛṣṇa engages Arjuna to serve His purpose.
